snippet: A woman was reportedly denied a potentially lifesaving abortion while she was having a miscarriage.
abstract: Death of Savita Halappanavar, who was reportedly denied potentially lifesaving abortion even while she was having miscarriage, revives debate over Ireland's almost total ban on abortions; Irish Supreme Court ruled in 1992 that abortion is permissible in certain cases, but Irish government has yet to pass a law to this effect.
lead_paragraph: A woman was reportedly denied a potentially lifesaving abortion while she was having a miscarriage.

headline.main: Hospital Death in Ireland Renews Fight Over Abortion
headline.print_headline: Hospital Death In Ireland Renews Fight Over Abortion
